member.name: T:USBHIDDRIVER.USBInterface
member.summary: Interface for the HID USB Driver.

member.name: F:USBHIDDRIVER.USBInterface.usbBuffer
member.summary: Buffer for incomming data.

member.name: M:USBHIDDRIVER.USBInterface.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The vendor id of the USB device (e.g. vid_06ba)
The product id of the USB device (e.g. pid_ffff)

member.name: M:USBHIDDRIVER.USBInterface.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The vendor id of the USB device (e.g. vid_06ba).

member.name: M:USBHIDDRIVER.USBInterface.Connect
member.summary: Establishes a connection to the USB device. You can only establish a connection to a device if you have used the construct with vendor AND product id. Otherwise it will connect to a device which has the same vendor id is specified, this means if more than one device with these vendor id is plugged in, you can't be determine to which one you will connect.

member.name: M:USBHIDDRIVER.USBInterface.Disconnect
member.summary: Disconnects the device

member.name: M:USBHIDDRIVER.USBInterface.getDeviceList
member.summary: Returns a list of devices with the vendor id (or vendor and product id) specified in the constructor. This function is needed if you want to know how many (and which) devices with the specified vendor id are plugged in.

member.name: M:USBHIDDRIVER.USBInterface.write(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Writes the specified bytes to the USB device. If the array length exceeds 64, the array while be divided into several arrays with each containing 64 bytes. The 0-63 byte of the array is sent first, then the 64-127 byte and so on.
member.returns: Returns true if all bytes have been written successfully

member.name: M:USBHIDDRIVER.USBInterface.startRead
member.summary: Starts reading. If you execute this command a thread is started which listens to the USB device and waits for data.

member.name: M:USBHIDDRIVER.USBInterface.stopRead
member.summary: Stops the read thread. By executing this command the read data thread is stopped and now data will be received.

member.name: M:USBHIDDRIVER.USBInterface.enableUsbBufferEvent(System.EventHandler)
member.summary: Enables the usb buffer event. Whenever a dataset is added to the buffer (and so received from the usb device) the event handler method will be called.

member.name: M:USBHIDDRIVER.TESTS.USBTestFixture.deviceList
member.summary: Test if the device list works.

member.summary: sends a start command

member.name: M:USBHIDDRIVER.TESTS.USBTestFixture.startRead
member.summary: Starts the read.

member.name: M:USBHIDDRIVER.TESTS.USBTestFixture.sendStopCMD
member.summary: Sends the stop command.

member.summary: Tests Users the definedevent handling.

member.summary: The event cacher.
member.param: The instance containing the event data.
